message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with index coding, a problem in information theory, which falls under the category of cs.IT (Information Theory). The specific problem studied in the paper involves neighboring interference, which is a common issue in wireless networks, and hence the paper could also be categorized under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper proposes a method to reduce the complexity of encoding and decoding index codes, which could be relevant to the field of cs.SI (Systems and Control). The paper also mentions the use of linear algebra in constructing index codes, which could be relevant to the field of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper discusses the broadcast rate of the problem, which is a measure of the efficiency of the index code, and hence the paper could also be categorized under cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
